p: Liver disease represents a group of disorders characterized by stages of progression from steatosis and hepatitis to cirrhosis and cancer. This diverse spectrum of hepatic diseases is markedly associated with the pathophysiology of the biliary system [ 9]. According to the pathological stages of hepatobiliary disease, the pharmacological activities of C. longa can be generally classified into hepatoprotective, antioxidant, antisteatotic and antilipidemic, anti-inflammatory, antifibrotic, antitumor, and cholagogic effects.
